info.title: ioTec Pay v1
info.description:
## Overview

The **ioTec Pay API** enables seamless integration between your systems and ioTec Pay services. With it, you can:

- **Collect Payments**: Receive mobile money payments directly into your ioTec Pay wallet.
- **Make Disbursements**: Send funds from your wallet to mobile money accounts or commercial bank accounts.
- **Manage Transactions**: Access and work with transaction data to streamline your financial operations.

This documentation provides detailed guidance on available endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication requirements to help you integrate ioTec Pay efficiently.

## Getting Started

To begin using the ioTec Pay API, you'll need to authenticate via **OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow**. This method ensures secure, authorized access.

### Where to get your API credentials

When you sign up for ioTec Pay, your `client_id` and `client_secret` are automatically sent to the **email address you used during registration**.

If you don't see the email:
- Please check your spam or promotions folder.
- Still can't find it? Reach out to our support team at **support@iotec.io** and we'll assist you.

Once you have your credentials, you can request an access token with the curl request below:

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url https://id.iotec.io/connect/token \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --data client_id=[client_id] \
  --data client_secret=[client_secret] \
  --data grant_type=client_credentials
```

The authorization server will  then return an access token in the following format:

```json
{
  "access_token": "xxxx.xxxxxxxxxxxxx.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
  "expires_in": 300,
  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "scope": "profile email"
}
```

Use the returned access token in the Authorization header of all your API requests as follows:

```bash
curl --request POST \
  --url https://pay.iotec.io/api/disbursements/disburse \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer [access_token]' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "category": "MobileMoney",
  "currency": "ITX",
  "walletId": "5e83b187-801e-410e-b76e-f491928547e0",
  "externalId": "001",
  "payee": "0111777771",
  "amount": 1000,
  "payerNote": "payerNote",
  "payeeNote": "payeeNote"
}'
```

These are the test phone numbers that you can use to test the mobile money transactions of the API:

| Number            | Result         | Description                                                  | Example    |
| :---              |    :----:      |          :----:                                              |    ---:    |
| 011177777(0-9)    | `Success`      | The transaction is successful                                | 0111777771 |
| 011177799(0-9)    | `Failed`       | The transaction has failed                                   | 0111777991 |
| 011177778(0-9)    | `Pending`      | The transaction is pending                                   | 0111777781 |
| 011177779(0-9)    | `SentToVendor` | The transaction is being processed by the vendor e.g., MTN   | 0111777791 |

## Callback Notifications

The ioTec Pay API can automatically notify your system when transaction statuses change to either `Success`, `Failed`, or `SentToVendor`,
eliminating the need for continuous polling.

### How callbacks work

1. Initiate a collection or disbursement request from your system to ioTec Pay.
2. ioTec Pay processes the transaction and **sends an HTTP POST request** to your configured callback URL when the transaction status is either `Success`, `Failed`, or `SentToVendor`.
3. The callback payload contains the complete transaction details, identical to the response from the *Get request details* endpoint.

**Example callback payload:**
```json
{
  "id": "3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6",
  "status": "Success",
  "amount": 10000,
  "currency": "UGX",
  // ...additional transaction details
}
```

### Setting up callback URLs

To configure callback notifications:

1. Log in to the [ioTec Pay portal](https://pay.iotec.io) and navigate to your wallet's details page.
2. Under the _SETTINGS_ tab, locate the **Callback URLs** card, and click the _Add_ button.
3. In the dialog form, provide the following:
   - **Callback Category**: Choose between the Collection or Disbursement categories
   - **Callback URL**: Your endpoint URL (e.g., `https://your-domain.com/api/payments/callback`)
   - **Security Headers**: Authentication headers (e.g., Authorization tokens) that ioTec Pay should include when calling your endpoint
4. Submit the form to save your callback configuration.

Once configured, ioTec Pay will automatically send transaction updates to your specified endpoint for all future transactions on that wallet.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to perform a mobile money collection request from a specified payer to your ioTec Pay wallet.

The transaction flow works as follows:
1. A collection request is initiated
2. The payer receives a prompt on their mobile device
3. The transaction remains in `Pending` status until:
   - The payer authorizes the payment (status changes to `Success`)
   - The payer declines the payment (status changes to `Failed`)
   - The system times out the request (status changes to `Failed`)

You can check the transaction status using:
```
GET api/collections/status/{transactionId}
```

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: OAuth2 bearer token, got from id.iotec.io

get.description: This endpoint is used to get the details of a collection transaction including the `status`.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the transaction you want to check. This is the `id` field from the response body returned when you initiated the collection.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: OAuth2 bearer token, got from id.iotec.io

get.description: This endpoint is used to get the details of a collection transaction including the `status` with the use of your own reference ID (`externalId`).

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Your custom unique identifier/reference for the transaction. This is the value you provided in the `externalId` field when initiating the collection.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: OAuth2 bearer token, got from id.iotec.io

get.description: This endpoint is used to retrieve a list of collection requests made.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of your ioTec Pay wallet.

parameters.description: Your custom unique identifier/reference for the transaction. This is the value you provide in the `externalId` field when initiating the collection.

parameters.name: StatusCodes
parameters.description: Status codes corresponding to the request status in a machine friendly format.

parameters.name: PartnerId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the partner account.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description:
Free-text search parameter that searches across multiple fields. 
Use this for general search when you don't need to filter by a specific field.

parameters.name: Skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip before starting to return results.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in a single request.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve when paginating results.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: Number of records to return per page when using page-based pagination.

parameters.name: OrderBy
parameters.description: Field name to sort results by.

parameters.name: Order
parameters.description: Sort direction for results.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: Filter for records created on or after this date and time. Used to specify the start of a date range filter.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: Filter for records created on or before this date and time. Used to specify the end of a date range filter.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: OAuth2 bearer token, got from id.iotec.io

id.description: The unique identifier of the bank.

code.description: The Bank Identification Code, also known as swift code.

bankId.description: The reference BankID from the ioTec platform, set this if you do not have the Bank Identification Code

bankIdentificationCode.description: The Bank Identification Code, also known as swift code

walletId.description: The unique identifier of your ioTec Pay wallet from which funds will be withdrawn.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

accountName.description: The full name of the bank account holder as it appears on the recipient's bank account.

accountNumber.description: The recipient account, this should be a valid account number

amount.description: The amount that will be withdrawn from your ioTec Pay wallet. This must be at least 500.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the recipient.

channel.description: Specifies the source channel for this transaction. This is optional.

sendAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction is to be executed. If not provided, the transaction will be executed immediately.

bankIdentificationCode.description: The Bank Identification Code, also known as swift code.

mainBranchName.description: The name of the main branch of the bank.

accountNumberRegex.description: A regular expression that matches valid account numbers for this bank.

walletId.description: The unique identifier of your ioTec Pay wallet from which this collection will be credited.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

payer.description: The mobile number of the person making the payment. This should be an MSISDN (256XXXXXXXXX or 0XXXXXXXXX).

payerNote.description: A message to be included for the payer's reference to this transaction.

amount.description: Amount that will be debited from the payer's account. This must be at least 500.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the API user.

channel.description: Specifies the source channel for this transaction. This is optional.

statusCode.description: Status code corresponding to the request status in a machine friendly format.

statusMessage.description: Additional details regarding the status received.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

amount.description: Amount that will be debited from the payer account.

payerNote.description: A message to be included for the payer's reference to this transaction.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the recipient.

chargeModel.description: The charging model applied to this transaction

createdBy.description: The user id that created this transaction

totalTransactionCharge.description: The total transaction fee, combining both ioTec transaction charges and vendor transaction charges.

vendorTransactionId.description: The ID tracked by the vendor

payer.description: The mobile number of the person making the payment. This should be an MSISDN (256XXXXXXXXX or 0XXXXXXXXX).

disbursementId.description: The unique identifier of the disbursement transaction that requires approval.

decision.description: Indicates whether this transaction was approved(`true`) or rejected(`false`).

remarks.description: Comments provided by the checker when approving or rejecting the transaction.
remarks.example: Approved after verifying recipient details with client.

walletId.description: The unique identifier of your ioTec Pay wallet from which funds will be withdrawn.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

payeeName.description: The name of the recipient receiving the funds.

payeeEmail.description: Email address of the recipient to be notified on disbursement.

payee.description: The recipient's mobile money account, this should be a valid MSISDN

amount.description: The amount that will be withdrawn from your ioTec Pay wallet. This must be at least 500.

payerNote.description: A message to be included for the payer's reference to this transaction.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the recipient.

channel.description: Specifies the source channel for this transaction. This is optional.

bankId.description: The reference BankID from the ioTec platform, set this if you do not have the Bank Identification Code

bankIdentificationCode.description: The Bank Identification Code, also known as swift code

sendAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction is to be executed. If not provided, the transaction will be executed immediately.

statusCode.description: Status code corresponding to the request status in a machine friendly format.

statusMessage.description: Additional details regarding the status received.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

amount.description: Amount that will be debited from the payer account.

payerNote.description: A message to be included for the payer's reference to this transaction.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the recipient.

chargeModel.description: The charging model applied to this transaction

createdBy.description: The user id that created this transaction

totalTransactionCharge.description: The total transaction fee, combining both ioTec transaction charges and vendor transaction charges.

vendorTransactionId.description: The ID tracked by the vendor

payee.description: The recipient's mobile money account, this should be a valid MSISDN.

payeeName.description: The name under which the recipient's mobile money account is registered.

payeeUploadName.description: The name of the recipient receiving the funds. This is the `payeeName` provided when initiating the disbursement.

bulkId.description:
The unique identifier of the parent bulk disbursement transaction that this individual disbursement transaction belongs to.
Only provided when this transaction was created as part of a bulk disbursement.

internalRequestId.description: The internal transaction id generated by this system, in case the vendor does support guid

bankId.description: The unique identifier of the destination bank for this transfer. This is only for bank transfers

approvalDecision.description: Indicates whether this transaction was approved or rejected.

decisionMadeBy.description: This identifies the person who approved or rejected the transaction after it was initiated.

decisionMadeAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction was approved or rejected.

decisionRemarks.description: Comments provided by the checker when approving or rejecting the transaction.
decisionRemarks.example: Approved after verifying recipient details with client.

sendAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction is to be executed. If not provided, the transaction will be executed immediately.

decisions.description: The decisions made on this disbursement transaction.

statusCode.description: Status code corresponding to the request status in a machine friendly format.

statusMessage.description: Additional details regarding the status received.

externalId.description: A reference to the transaction used by your external system for reconciliation purposes. It is not required to be unique.

amount.description: Amount that will be debited from the payer account.

payerNote.description: A message to be included for the payer's reference to this transaction.

payeeNote.description: A message to be included for payee's reference, in this case, the recipient.

chargeModel.description: The charging model applied to this transaction

createdBy.description: The user id that created this transaction

totalTransactionCharge.description: The total transaction fee, combining both ioTec transaction charges and vendor transaction charges.

vendorTransactionId.description: The ID tracked by the vendor

payee.description: The recipient's mobile money account, this should be a valid MSISDN.

payeeName.description: The name under which the recipient's mobile money account is registered.

payeeUploadName.description: The name of the recipient receiving the funds. This is the `payeeName` provided when initiating the disbursement.

bulkId.description:
The unique identifier of the parent bulk disbursement transaction that this individual disbursement transaction belongs to.
Only provided when this transaction was created as part of a bulk disbursement.

internalRequestId.description: The internal transaction id generated by this system, in case the vendor does support guid

bankId.description: The unique identifier of the destination bank for this transfer. This is only for bank transfers

approvalDecision.description: Indicates whether this transaction was approved or rejected.

decisionMadeBy.description: This identifies the person who approved or rejected the transaction after it was initiated.

decisionMadeAt.description: Timestamp when the transaction was approved or rejected.

decisionRemarks.description: Comments provided by the checker when approving or rejecting the transaction.
decisionRemarks.example: Approved after verifying recipient details with client.

sendAt.description: The timestamp when the transaction is to be executed. If not provided, the transaction will be executed immediately.

id.description: The unique identifier of the wallet.

actualBalance.description: The current total balance in the wallet, displayed according to the specified `currency`.

availableBalance.description: Balance that can be used for transaction.

collectionCallBackUrl.description: Webhook URL where collection transaction status updates will be sent automatically.

disbursementCallBackUrl.description: Webhook URL where disbursement transaction status updates will be sent automatically.
